snippet: Paramount led all Hollywood studios with $5.2 billion in global ticket sales. Warner surpassed the $4 billion mark for the third consecutive season.
abstract: Paramount led all Hollywood studios with $5.2 billion in global ticket sales. Warner surpassed the $4 billion mark for the third consecutive season.
lead_paragraph: It's box-office bragging rights season in Hollywood. On Monday Paramount Pictures claimed its prize, noting in a press release that it sold $5.2 billion in tickets worldwide in 2011, enough to end Warner Brothers' No. 1 reign.

headline.main: Paramount Claims Box-Office Bragging Rights. Warner Claims Bragging Rights II
